data.title: What aircraft is this? (Movie: All the Way, Boys)
data.meta_description: Hello, just saw an old (but good) movie again and am asking what aircraft plata are flying. The english title is All the Way, Boys, the german one: 2 Himmelhunde auf dem Weg zur Hölle and the original title is Più forte, ragazzi. Its a movie with Bud Spencer and Terence Hill. Here is a link to yo...
data.text:
Hello,

just saw an old (but good) movie again and am asking what aircraft plata are flying. The english title is All the Way, Boys, the german one: 2 Himmelhunde auf dem Weg zur Hölle and the original title is Più forte, ragazzi.

It's a movie with Bud Spencer and Terence Hill.

Here is a link to youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6gOOFnQ3leE

At 1:22:35 you see it from outside.

At 1:25:44 you see it again. It's a 2 engine turbopro I think.

Would be nice, if someone can say more.

Yes, I think Zach is closer spot on. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avro_748

That's what he did. My two shots are from those marks to allow an easier viewing.

Don't know how I missed that! :blush: What's scarier is that I scoured the post for the times. Duh!

Perhaps a YS-11.

The YS-11 is has a similar size (the YS-11 is bigger) and the same RR Dart engines, but the nose section and tail are very different. Focus on the vertical stabilzer and you'll notice the YS-11's is "curved" while the HS-748 is "squared". The radome on the YS-11 is longer as well. Finally, you can count windows and notice cockpit window shape.
